article.title: The Status and Needs of Medical School Libraries in the United States
article.author: Bloomquist, H.
article.text: This paper, prepared at the request of the National Library of Medicine, is the result of a study of the status and needs of the libraries of 86 medical schools and schools of basic medical sciences which are institutional members of the Association of American Medical Libraries and are approved by the American Medical Association. It is intended to summarize the impact of changing experiments in medical research, education and practice on the collections, serving housing, and staffs of medical school libraries.
